title: Some folders (e.g. '[Gmail]/All Mail on xxxxxx@gmail.com') cannot be compacted because there is not enough free disk space. Please delete some files and try again.
content:
I get a message like this every time I start Thunderbird. The topic came up last year but the conclusion was along the lines of "...this problem will be fixed in version 128" but it was never clear whether or not the User followed Mozilla's support replies or what they had to do to clear the email message from Thunderbird. .....Well I'm running version 128.1.1esr and the problem still exists.

My questions:

1. What is Thunderbird trying to do? Compact individual email files? Compae from ct the whole Thunderbird Profiles folder?

2. Is the problem the size of the Profiles folder or the overall size of the hard drive the Profiles folder resides on? What is the Hard/solidstate drive is the maximum?

3. Is the problem related to the amount of Free Space left on the Hard/solidstate drive or is the issue the number of individual files?

4. Is the issue related to the number of Thunderbird files and/or folders OR is it related to the total number of files and/or folders on the hard drive?

5. Is there a limit to the number of sub-folder levels that Thunderbird can navigate?

Thank you.

Tom

Tom O'Brien TOBrienArchitect@gmail.com

title: Cancellazione massiva mail
content:
All'incirca il 20 agosto mi sono accordo che nella Posta di Libero che uso da tantissimi anni e in cui la posta occupava all'incirca 3,5 Giga, lo spazio occupato si era ridotto a circa 700Mega. Il 29 agosto ho attivato una chat di assistenza con libero. Mi hanno detto da fare alcune verifiche sulle impostazioni di Libero e mi hanno chiesto : 

"Utilizzi un Client (Outlook, Thunderbird, Mail…) o la webmail insieme a un client?

Le email restano sui server Libero (nella webmail) se consulti la casella dal sito, oppure da un client o app configurati col protocollo IMAP. Se invece usi (o hai usato) dei client in POP (senza l’opzione per mantenere copia dei messaggi sul server), i messaggi vengono scaricati nel tuo dispositivo (Pc): quindi non saranno più nella webmail (server). Nel caso ti consigliamo di accedere al dispositivo con client POP e verificare nelle "Cartelle locali" o in qualche backup che puoi aver fatto.

Io ho usato Thunderbird una sola volta in giugno quindi molto prima del 20 agosto.

Ho aperto nuovamente Thunderbird (il 29 agosto) per verificare come erano le impostazioni richieste:anche li non vedevo le mail sparite in Libero, ho fatto le verifiche che mi avevano chiesto di fare: il tutto con esito positivo: ho verificato che usa il server: imapmail.libero.it e non c'era nessuna programmazione per cancellare la posta sul server di Libero . A seguito di questo II utilizzo di Thunderbird occupazione della posta era ulteriormente calata: 143Mega. In pratica ho perso quasi tutta la posta comprese le numerose cartelle che mi ero creato per fare ordine nell posta.

LA DOMANDA CHE PONGO è LA SEGUENTE: ESISTE UNA CONFIGURAZIONE DI THUNDERBIRD CHE A SEGUITO DELLA SUA SOLA APERTURA CANCELLA COSì TANTA POSTA (TUTTE LE CARTELLE: QUELLE CREATE PER FARE ORDINE COMPLETAMENTE VUOTE , QUELLA DELLA POSTA ARRIVATA CIRA 200 MAIL SU NON SO QUANTE MIGLIAIA, IDEM SULLA POSTA INVIATA)? O DEVO IMPUTARE A QUANTO è SUCCESSO AD UN BACO DI THUNDERBIRD?
creator: dinogalletti01

title: Autoupload remote images
content:
I'm using Thunderbird to write artist newsletters.

This involves a lot of formatting & design. I'm currently in the habit of composing my email in Thunderbird, copy-pasting the images into place, resizing them, taking screenshots of them, and then copy-pasting THAT into their place so that I'm not rudely sending lots of massive high-resolution images through email. But that's a little tedious and still leads to emails several MB large. So I'd like to swap that out for remote images, but doing all that AND uploading them to a server and copying the URL for each strikes me as even more tedious and time-consuming, which is a drag on my writing process.

Is there any way that I can get Thunderbird to automatically upload images to a specified server before sending?

title: Latest version of Thunderbird downloads deleted messaged from gmail,  2nd request.
content:
Since a recent TB update in August, the program now downloads previously-deleted messages from Gmail. TB downloads from the In folder (OKI), but also current messages that I sent to Trash folder (not OK).

Example: 50 new messages appear in the Gmail In folder. I delete 30 messages from the In folder, and they correctly move to the Trash folder, leaving 20 in the In folder.

I next launch TB on my Win10 PC and press F5 to begin the download. Until recently, I would get the remaining 20 messages and ONLY the 20. Now, TB downloads all 50, as if 30 were never deleted. 

                                                       NOTE:  I changed no settings at either end.'

If I go into the Trash folder before downloading and delete today's trash, those messages are totally gone and won't download. But this was never necessary a few weeks ago.

If any reader had and fixed this annoying problem, please tell me how you did it.
creator: larry41

title: [SOLVED] How can I delete an undeletable folder ?
content:
Hi. I have created 2 subfolders in "Drafts", which ALSO turned into draft folders:

  • The folder icons switched from the standard folder icon to the "Drafts" icon.
  • The right-click context menu is reduced (just like for other special folders), e.g. the "delete" command is missing.

So how can I delete this misbehaving folder now ?

I doublechecked in my account manager and via config editor that the subfolder are NOT used as DRAFTS folder for any of my (POP3/maildir) accounts.

Thank you so much.

There should be a bunch of crash reports. I am not at the computer right now but at work. I wanted to find out if the crash reports are pointing at anything in particular that I could do. thank you Dave Mulkearns

title: Cannot create email account
content: I had been using Thunderbird for many months with no issues. I deleted that email account and re-entered information, each time Mozilla found the account on the server, but will not accept the password. NOTE: I was able to create an account both with Outlook and Yahoo mail using the exact same user/password. I also have 2 other email accounts on Thunderbird, both are functioning fine. Is there something preventing me from creating this particular email account? The server is ATT and they used Yahoo for email.

title: compacting folders
content: I responded to a message when opening my Thunderbird email program that asked to "compact now" - I did and my "Trash" has been a huge mess since. When I try to delete a message in the trash there are some that suddenly add many former messages. I then cannot delete that message and have to go to "Force quit" on my IMac for Thunderbird. This I have "reported" numerous times with no help appearing ever. This terrible behavior of my email program that I have used now for over 2 decades is consuming a huge amount of unproductive time. When this refusal to respond on clicking "delete" in the trash there is a long wait time until I can restart an begin work again. Clicking on "Compact now" promised to work "without changing your messages." - clearly not true! Please help. Is there a way to back out of "Compact folders automatically..."?

title: Can I create collections of folders?
content:
Hi,

Is there a way to make collections of folders? I have multiple account and I would like to make collections of inboxes so I can see everything at a glance.

For example, I could have one collection called "Clients" for… well, clients, another one for "Personal," another for "Marketing," etc. Then I would like to be able to group certain inboxes under a specific collection.

It's a bit like unified folders, but multiple unified folders instead of one that groups all inboxes.

title: Two instances of Thunderbird on computer
content:
I had a problem with a new upgrade for TB and was asked by another moderator on this site to update my version of TB (128.1.1esr 64-bit) to v128.2. My version of TB did not recognize the need for an update and so I downloaded and installed TB 128.2. It successfully installed as an upgrade but in a wholly different folder under C:\Program Files\MozillaThunderbird. The previous instance of TB, 128.1.1, was installed in a different location under C:\Program FIles\WindowsApps\Mozilla Thunderbird. Under control panel I see only one instance of TB and that is the new v128.2. Under Windows Settings, Apps and Features, there are two instances of TB.

Both instances appear to be seeing the mail profile so the only thing I want to know is if it is possible and how to remove the old version of TB without losing the mail profiles. Or do I uninstall the new version and roll back? In any event I do not want to lose a mail profile with years of information.

title: Folders italicising, disappearing
content:
With Respect

Thunderbird is causing subfolders within my Inbox to first show their names in italics and no contents then disappear altogether.

The folder Medical and later the folder IreneLyon, have disappeared altogether. The folders Scams and MummyBellNet exist in both italic/empty and intact versions. The folder Inoreader exists only in intact/empty form.

The italicization part has happened before and I eventually got those folders back but I cannot find notes from that.

There have been aberrations and odd sequences of events in Thunderbird, obviously related to this and not, which I cannot now reconstruct or describe.

Recently I looked at Help-About and was updated, on going into it, from 115.14.0 (64-bit) Supernova to 128.1.1esr (64-bit) Nebula. 

                       Yours Sincerely, 
                            Alan E. Dunne
